Usage

Starting the webserver

First, you need to activate the virtual environment, navigate to the tool directory and start the flask server. Make sure you are in a directory that you can activate your virtual environment from. If you are not, navigate to the directory where you installed the virtual environment and activate it from there.

#if you gave your env another name, use that one instead of pylovovenv
source pylovovenv/bin/activate
cd path/to/pylovo/gui/IDP_Maptool_Flask
flask --app maptool --debug run

We are setting multiple flags for running the server:

  • app: The name of the folder containing the init file for the flask code, in this case maptool

  • debug: If this flag is not set, the server will not automatically restart, if adjustments to the code are made

Make sure you have connected to the LRZ net via EduVPN, otherwise the tool will not be able to access the pylovo database.

Accessing the tool

Open a browser of your choice and enter the address http://127.0.0.1:5000.
You should now have the following view:
The tool opens to the area selection page by default.
